abstract: Testing for active SARS-CoV-2 infection is a fundamental tool in the public health measures taken to control the COVID-19 pandemic. Due to the overwhelming use of SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR tests worldwide, availability of test kits has become a major bottleneck. Here we demonstrate pooling strategies to perform RNA extraction and RT-PCR in pools, significantly increasing throughput while maintaining clinical sensitivity. We implemented the method in a routine clinical diagnosis setting of asymptomatic populations, and already tested 5,464 individuals for SARS-CoV-2 using 731 RNA extraction and RT-PCR kits. We identified six SARS-CoV-2 positive patients corresponding to 0.11% of the tested population.
author: Irit Fogel; Eran Meshorer; Gil Benedek; Maayan Salton; Esther Oiknine-Djian; Yuval Dor; Matan Seidel; Agnes Klochendler; Zeev Rotstein; Dana G Wolf; The Hebrew University-Hadassah COVID-19 diagnosis team; Ori Gurel-Gurevich; Yotam Drier; Bruno Lavi; Asaf Gertler; Roni Ben-Ami; Moran Yassour; Tal Sido
title: Large-scale implementation of pooled RNA-extraction and RT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 detection
